metadata.title: CVE-2023-52473 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:thermal: core: Fix NULL pointer dereference in zone registration error pathIf device_register() in thermal_zone_device_register_with_trips() returnsan error, the tz variable is set to NULL and subsequently dereferenced inkfree(tz->tzp). Commit adc8749b150c ("thermal/drivers/core: Useput_device() if device_register() fails") added the tz = NULL assignment inquestion to avoid a possible double-free after dropping the reference tothe zone device. However, after commit 4649620d9404 ("thermal: core: Makethermal_zone_device_unregister() return after freeing the zone"), thatassignment has become redundant, because dropping the reference to the zonedevice does not cause the zone object to be freed any more. Drop it toaddress the NULL pointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-generic-64k - 6.5.0-41.41
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-azure - 6.5.0-1022.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-gcp - 6.5.0-1022.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-lowlatency - 6.5.0-41.41.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-41.41.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1018-raspi - 6.5.0-1018.21
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1015-starfive - 6.5.0-1015.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-41.41').
linux-aws package in mantic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-azure package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1022.23').
linux-gcp package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1022.24').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-lowlatency package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-41.41.1').
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-raspi package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1018.21').
linux-starfive package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1015.16').
